qas.question: Other than the base of a side branch, what tree feature causes a knot?
What shape is the knot formed by a side branch's base?
What measurement of a stem determines a knot's inner tip placement?
Because a knot's shape is conical, what shape does a cross-section of it have?

context: In the tree a knot is either the base of a side branch or <a0_0>a dormant bud<a0_0/>. A knot (when the base of a side branch) is <a1_0>conical<a1_0/> in shape (hence the roughly <a3_0>circular<a3_0/> cross-section) with the inner tip at the point in stem <a2_0>diameter<a2_0/> at which the plant's vascular cambium was located when the branch formed as a bud.
